name: Movies Titles with States' Names - Part 1 Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which star, much better known for his singing roles, played the leading part in the 1968 Paramount movie "Arizona Bushwhackers"?
questions.explanation:
Howard Keel.

	Amongst the other featured actors in this movie were Yvonne de Carlo, Brian Donlevy and John Ireland. The plot is about a Confederate prisoner who is given a new chance as the sheriff of a western town. The unseen narrator is Jimmy Cagney.

questions.text: "The Arkansas Traveller" was made in 1938 for Paramount. It starred Bob Burns and Fay Bainter. Which is the correct outline of its plot?
questions.correct: A small-town widow keeps her newspaper going with the help of a stranger passing through
options: A musical in which the antics of a horse save the show.
A police detective keeps hot on the trail of a bandit on a killing spree.
The sheriff of a small western town has to face killing his brother, an outlaw.
questions.explanation:
A small-town widow keeps her newspaper going with the help of a stranger passing through.

	The original story was by Jack Cunningham and the movie was directed for Paramount by Alfred Santell.

questions.text: Who played the part of the Mississippi gambler in the movie of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Tyrone Power.

	Piper Laurie, John McIntyre, Julia Adams and Dennis Weaver were the other leading actors in this movie about an honest showboat gambler who finally ends up marrying the sister of one of his victims.

questions.text: In which film about Alaska do John Wayne and Stewart Granger get involved in gold prospecting and woman trouble?
questions.explanation:
North to Alaska.

	Capucine plays the beautiful lady who catches their attention. As usual in John Wayne movies, there is plenty of brawling to fill the screen. Finding the gold proves to be the easy part of the prospectors' experiences.

questions.text: A novel by James Michener formed the basis for two movies about Hawaii. One was simply called "Hawaii" and starred Max von Sydow. The other one starred Charlton Heston but what was the name of this movie?
questions.explanation:
The Hawaiians.

	A powerful family is split by arguments over money, race and marriage. Oil finds in unpromising terrain does not bring the solutions to the problems. The movie also starred Tina Chen and Geraldine Chaplin. The British title of the movie was "Master of the Islands".

questions.text: "Kansas Raiders" was yet another movie about Quantrill's Raiders, with the concentration on the part played by Jesse James and his gang. Who was the leading star?
questions.explanation:
Audie Murphy.

	This is a movie which proceeds at a very fast pace and involves a lot of violent action. Most experts agree that it bears little relationship to any of the facts. It also starred Brian Donlevy, Marguerite Chapman, Scott Brady, Tony Curtis and Richard Long.

questions.text: To get two states in one we have a movie called "Dakota". This is a John Wayne film. Which of the following best describes its plot?
questions.correct: The daughter of a railroad tycoon elopes with a cowboy and they get involved in a land war.
options: A small-town sheriff runs for the post of state governor.
An Indian scout from Texas falls in love with the daughter of a renegade chief.
A small-town in the north country is freed of the grip of a ruthless family of outlaws.
questions.explanation:
The daughter of a railroad tycoon elopes with a cowboy and they get involved in a land war.

	"Dakota" was a Republic film of 1945. Carl Foreman had a hand in writing the original story. Wayne's co-stars included Vera Hruba Ralston, Walter Brennan and Ward Bond.

questions.text: There are several movies with "California" in the title. From the list of genuine titles select the one that is about the guests at the Beverly Hills Hotel.
questions.explanation:
California Suite.

	Four stories for the price of one was the idea of this movie. Neil Simon's play was adapted for the screen with the pairings of Maggie Smith and Michael Caine, Walter Matthau and Elaine May, Alan Alda and Jane Fonda and Richard Pryor and Bill Cosby.

questions.text: Who are the stars of the western movie "The Missouri Breaks"?
questions.explanation:
Marlon Brando and Jack Nicholson.

	Strangely enough the action appears to be set in Montana where ranchers and rustlers fight over both land and the animals on it. However, it is really the River Missouri that gives the movie its title. Both Brando and co-star Jack Nicholson seem to relish the savagery that they serve up for director Arthur Penn.

questions.text: Supply the correct adjective to complete the title of the movie "The ___ Skies of Montana".
questions.explanation:
Red.

	This movie was also known as "Smoke Jumpers" and starred Richard Widmark, Jeffrey Hunter, Constance Smith, Richard Boone and Richard Crenna in a story about the firefighters in the mountains of Montana.
